Optimized for newer Android versions. Open-source and FOSS-friendly.

name: Microsoft PowerToys
description: A set of system utilities to tune and streamline the Windows experience. Unlocks 'FancyZones' for window management, 'PowerToys Run' for quick launching, and 'Text Extractor' to copy text from any image.
author: Microsoft

name: Lively Wallpaper
description: Free and open-source software that brings your desktop to life. Set videos, GIFs, and webpages as your wallpaper. A completely free alternative to Wallpaper Engine.

name: Files
description: A modern file manager that pushes the boundaries of the Windows platform. Features tabs, dual pane, tags, and a beautiful UI that matches Windows 11 perfectly.

name: Rectify11
description: A modded installer/tool that fixes Windows 11's UI inconsistencies. It updates old icons, enforces dark mode on legacy menus (like Control Panel), and removes bloatware.

name: Chris Titus Tech's WinUtil
description: Unlocks full control over Windows. This utility allows you to debloat the system, disable telemetry, set services to manual, and install essential apps in bulk.
author: ChrisTitusTech

name: Magpie
description: Unlocks high-performance upscaling (like FSR or Anime4K) for any windowed application. It turns any window into a full-screen experience with advanced scaling algorithms.
author: Blinue

name: Ventoy
description: Unlocks the ability to boot multiple OS ISOs from a single USB drive. No need to reformat your drive; just drag and drop ISO files and boot them directly.

name: WinScript
description: An open-source tool for Windows 10/11 to debloat, enhance privacy, boost performance, and install apps via scripts, unlocking a customized OS experience.
author: Chris Titus

name: TranslucentTB
description: An open-source utility for Windows that customizes the taskbar with transparency, blur, and color effects, unlocking modern aesthetics for free.
author: TranslucentTB Team

name: KeePassXC
description: A modern, secure, and open-source password manager. It stores all your passwords in a single encrypted database, secured by a master password or key file, and supports auto-typing.
author: KeePassXC Team

name: GIMP
description: The Free & Open Source Image Editor. It is a powerful, cross-platform tool for high-quality photo manipulation, retouching, original artwork creation, and graphic design elements. The best free alternative to Photoshop.
author: The GIMP Team

name: qBittorrent
description: A free, open-source, and cross-platform BitTorrent client. It provides a clean, ad-free interface, integrated torrent search engine, and remote control capabilities, offering a superior and ethical torrenting experience.
author: Christophe Dumez

name: CrystalDiskInfo
description: An essential open-source utility that monitors and displays the health status (via S.M.A.R.T. data) and temperature of your Hard Drives (HDD), Solid State Drives (SSD), and NVMe drives, helping you anticipate potential drive failures.
author: hiyohiyo (Crystal Dew World)

name: Core Temp
description: A compact, no-fuss program to monitor the temperature of each individual core of your processor (CPU) in real-time. Essential for diagnosing overheating, stability, and overclocking issues. It is freeware and frequently updated.
author: Arthur Liberman (Alcpu)

name: Shotcut
description: A free, open-source, cross-platform video editor. It supports a vast number of video, audio, and image formats and features a simple, modular interface with no paywalls or watermarks on exports.
author: Meltytech, LLC

name: Thunderbird
description: A free, open-source email, calendar, and contacts application developed by the Mozilla Foundation. It is focused on privacy, security, and giving users maximum control over their communications.
author: MZLA Technologies Corporation (Mozilla)

name: WinSCP
description: A powerful and free SFTP, FTP, SCP, and S3 client for Windows. It is an essential tool for transferring files securely between a local computer and remote servers, featuring a dual-pane graphical interface.
author: Martin Prikryl

name: LibreOffice
description: A powerful, free, and open-source office suite—the spiritual successor to OpenOffice. It includes Writer (word processor), Calc (spreadsheet), Impress (presentations), and is compatible with Microsoft Office formats.
author: The Document Foundation

name: VLC Media Player
description: The quintessential open-source media player. It plays virtually every multimedia file format imaginable, including DVDs, Audio CDs, VCDs, and various streaming protocols, with zero ads or spyware.
author: VideoLAN

name: Chocolatey
description: The package manager for Windows. It provides a command-line interface (CLI) to install, update, and remove applications and tools quickly and automatically. It essentially brings the convenience of Linux package management (like 'apt' or 'dnf') to Windows.
author: Chocolatey Software

name: Ninite
description: The easiest way to automatically install and update multiple popular Windows applications at once. It runs completely unattended, skips all junkware, toolbars, and prompts, saving significant time during a new PC setup.
author: SecureByDesign Inc.

name: Scoop
description: A command-line installer for Windows that keeps programs isolated and installs them to your user directory (no Admin privileges needed). It is fully open-source and provides a vast repository of developer and desktop applications, often preferred over Chocolatey by tech enthusiasts.
author: ScoopInstaller Community

name: ClamWin Free Antivirus
description: A popular, free, and open-source antivirus scanner for Windows, based on the reliable ClamAV engine. It features a scanning scheduler and integration with Windows Explorer and Microsoft Outlook, but notably does NOT include a real-time scanner.
author: ClamWin Team

name: ToffeeShare
description: A secure, browser-based, peer-to-peer (P2P) file sharing service. It allows sharing files of any size directly between devices with end-to-end encryption. Files are never stored online, and no account is required.
author: Stofkat / Dirk De Boer

name: DroidCam (PC Client)
description: Transforms your Android device into a high-quality webcam for your PC (Windows/Linux) via Wi-Fi or USB. The free version offers unlimited standard definition (SD) usage, making it a great alternative to purchasing a dedicated webcam.
author: Dev47Apps

name: OBS Studio
description: The world's leading free and open-source software for video recording and live streaming. It features real-time capture, scene composition, and broadcasting via RTMP, supporting all major platforms like Twitch and YouTube.
author: OBS Project

name: NanaZip
description: An open-source file archiver intended for the modern Windows experience. It is a derivative of the famous 7-Zip, adding a modernized Windows 11-style interface, Mica effect support, and native integration into the new Windows context menu.
author: M2Team (Kenji Mouri)

name: Obsidian
description: A powerful and flexible knowledge management application. It stores your notes in a local folder of plain text Markdown files and is famous for its 'Graph View' feature that visualizes the connections between your ideas. Free for personal use.
author: Dynalist, Inc.

name: Sumatra PDF
description: A minimalist, lightweight, and fast document viewer for Windows. It supports PDF, ePub, Mobi, XPS, DjVu, CHM, and Comic Book files (CBZ/CBR). It's famous for its speed and low memory usage, making it a perfect alternative to large, bloated readers.
author: Krzysztof Kowalczyk

name: Clover
description: An extension for Windows Explorer that adds Chrome-style multi-tab functionality and bookmark bar features directly to the default file manager. It greatly enhances navigation and productivity within Windows Explorer.
author: EJIE Technology

name: ThrottleStop
description: An advanced utility for Windows designed to monitor and fix the three main types of CPU throttling: Power Limit, Thermal, and Electrical. It allows users to adjust clock speeds, set custom power limits (PL1/PL2), undervolt the CPU, and achieve maximum consistent performance, especially on laptops.
author: Unclewebb

name: Recuva
description: A popular, user-friendly, freemium data recovery utility for Windows. It can recover files accidentally deleted from hard drives, memory cards, USB drives, and even recently formatted or damaged drives, offering both a quick scan and an advanced deep scan option.
author: Piriform Software (Avast)

name: Resource Hacker™
description: A freeware utility that acts as both a resource compiler and a decompiler for 32-bit and 64-bit Windows applications (*.exe, *.dll, etc.). It enables users to view, modify, add, or delete resources like icons, menus, dialogs, bitmaps, and string tables within executable files for customization.
author: Angus Johnson

name: Process Tamer
description: A lightweight freeware utility that runs in the system tray and constantly monitors processes. When a process starts hogging the CPU, it temporarily reduces its priority to keep the system responsive for other tasks, effectively 'taming' runaway applications.
author: M. E. Thomas (DonationCoder)

description: A lightning-fast open-source file search utility for Windows that indexes names instantly, unlocking sub-second searches across drives without heavy resource use.

VIVI isn't just another music player — it's a complete audio experience designed for music lovers who demand more. With a sleek Material You-inspired design, intelligent features, and deep personalization, VIVI redefines how you connect with your music.

From stunning visual effects to smooth, intuitive controls, every element is crafted to match your vibe and elevate every beat. Stream from YouTube, enjoy synced lyrics, share songs via QR codes, and experience your music library like never before.

name: InstallerX revived
description:
Looking for a better app installer? Try InstallerX!

Many customized Chinese ROMs come with subpar default installers. You can replace them with InstallerX Revived.

Compared to stock installers, InstallerX Revived offers more installation features:

Rich installation types: APK, APKS, APKM, XAPK, APKs inside ZIP, and batch APKs.
Dialog-based installation
Notification-based installation (Live Activity API supported)
Automatic installation
Installer declaration
Setting install flags (can inherit Profile settings)
Install for specific user / all users
Dex2oat after successful installation
Block the installation of specific app's packageName or by sharedUID
Auto-delete APK after installation
No shell commands, native API calls only
